meanings.definition: Behaving in a dishonest or immoral way, especially in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: The sleazing salesman tried to trick customers with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She knew the sleazing politician was not to be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The sleazing fox thought he could outsmart the clever rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The sleazing tactics of the company left a stain on their reputation.
meanings.sent5: The sleazing behavior of the student was quickly noticed by the teacher.

meanings.sent4: She felt like someone was sleazing behind her back, watching her every move.
